DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Mitotic Count Rate Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Tthe yes/no indicator related to the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease by the medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, determining the number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pathology Report Mitotic Count Rate Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease by a report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment to determine the number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site.

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

Property.preferredDefinition: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI):The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors.  It is one of the parameters that determine the grade of malignant tumors.  The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined.  Usually the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
